Code Equality is a non-profit organization that aims to promote computer science awareness among young Malaysians.

Events

If you'd like to attend any of them, please check the event descriptions for registration details. Want latest updates on our events? Sign up for our mailing list .

Course

Introduction to Coding- A Weekend Camp

29-30th March '14, 9pm-5pm Wisma Jobstreet, Lorong Medan Tuanku 1, Kuala Lumpur

An introduction to coding with Python and HTML/CSS, for those who are curious

Introduction to Coding: A Weekend Camp

What is this?

This is a weekend introduction to coding course tailored for students who are interested in coding but have yet to venture into it. We’ll be doing sessions on general coding concepts, Python, and HTML/CSS to give you a little taste of each.

When and where is this happening?

March 29th-30th (Saturday & Sunday) at Wisma Jobstreet in Kuala Lumpur.

Is this for me?

Yes! If you’re interested in learning how to code, this is for you! We welcome everyone from all walks of life, but do note that this session is targeted to students who have no coding experience as we will be beginning from ground zero of programming.

We are limiting this session to 30 people only, but we will have waiting lists, so don’t hesitate to put your name in!

We do ask for a RM20 registration fee. At the end of the class, you may decide to have it refunded to you, or not.

How do I sign up?

Just fill out this online form here and we will email you with a confirmation of your seat in this course! We will notify you and put you on the waiting list if all seats have been taken.

I got a seat! What now?

Hang in tight till March the 29th! Do not hestitate to message us on Facebook at Code Equality or email us at codeequality@gmail.com for further questions.

Who are you guys? And why are you doing this?

To find out more about Code Equality, check out our About section.

I have more questions!

Just send them to us via Facebook or via email at codeequality@gmail.com and we’ll get back to you ASAP!

View details »

Talk

What Is It Like Working In Tech?

6 Feb '14, 4pm-5pm Audi 7, Sunway College

Hear from Carolyn Au, a software engineer at Google about working in the Silicon Valley, learning programming and pursuing Computer Science.

Sign up online here. For more information, please email us at codeequality@gmail.com.

Carolyn Au is a Senior Software Engineer at Google, working on Google Now. She previously worked on Google Desktop and Google+. Before joining Google, she was the Lead Frontend Engineer at Ruba, a social travel site. She is passionate about building intuitive and delightful user interfaces. Carolyn graduated with a BSc Computer Science and Human-Computer Interaction from Carnegie Mellon University.

About

What is Code Equality?

Code Equality is a non-profit initiative that aims to promote computer science among Malaysians, with the hope that those who gain early exposure would go on to pursue a career in tech.

Our goals are two-fold:

  • Making computer science education more accessible to all Malaysians.
  • Encouraging more women participation in computer science.

We believe in equal opportunities in learning computer science, hence our name -- Code Equality. As such, we strive to ensure our events are available to all.

Who are we?

We're currently a team of two co-founders.

Wunmin Wong Wunmin graduated from MIT in Management Science with minors in Energy and Economics. Her biggest regret is not majoring in Computer Science in university, hence she’s now turning that missed opportunity into a motivation to prevent other young Malaysians from having the same regret.

Sher Minn Chong Sher Minn graduated from the University of Wisconsin-Madison with a degree in Computer Science. She is a consultant at IBM Malaysia during the day and a freelance web developer and designer by night. She's always excited about teaching programming, web development and design, hand-brewed coffee and bad puns. You can find her on Twitter most days.

How did we start?

Long story short: it was difficult talking to organizations and schools as two random people who want to offer programming courses. It made sense to build an organization to represent our objectives. So here we are.

Get involved

Like what we do? Have an idea for an event?

If you're interested in getting involved with Code Equality, there are many ways you can help!

Teach or talk.

Regardless of whether you’re a coding ninja or a coding newb, if you have the enthusiasm to help others learn coding, teach a bootcamp with us or be a teaching assistant!

Host an event.

Invite us to your school or organization to hold a talk or bootcamp. We provide the content; you provide the venue.

Pitch us an idea!

Anything else you’d love us to organize? Let us know!

Sign up for our mailing list to receive latest updates on our events!
